turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Hôtel de Ville (Paris Métro).
turn.1: What is the Hotel de Ville (Paris Métro)?
turn.2: Hôtel de Ville (Paris Métro)  Hôtel de Ville (, literally "City Hall") is a rapid transit station on Lines 1 and 11 of the Paris Métro.
turn.3: Where is the Hotel de Ville located?
turn.4: The station lies within the fourth arrondissement of the central city, close to the Hôtel de Ville de Paris.
turn.5: Where is the Hotel de Ville located?
turn.6: Hôtel de Ville station is located in the fourth arrondissement of Paris, northeast of the centre of the Île de la Cité.
turn.7: When was the Hotel de Ville built?
turn.8: Hôtel de Ville is one of the eight original stations opened as part of the first stage of the line between Porte de Vincennes and Porte Maillot on 19 July 1900.
turn.9: When was the Hotel de Ville expanded?
turn.10: The line 11 platforms opened as part of the original section of the line from Châtelet to Porte des Lilas on 28 April 1935.
turn.11: Was the Hotel de Ville automated?
turn.12: In line with works to automate Line 1, Hôtel de Ville station has undergone a series of upgrades.
